Module lgarn67.appointmentapp
Package lgarn67.appointmentapp.helper

Class TimeChecks

java.lang.Object
lgarn67.appointmentapp.helper.TimeChecks
public class TimeChecks extends Object
Class that performs various checks on time, for appointment time validity, overlaps, and upcoming appointments

    • checkStartingTime

      public static boolean checkStartingTime(ZonedDateTime userStartTime)
      Checks the inputted start time against the business hours to ensure it is on or after 8AM eastern.
      Parameters:
      userStartTime - the start time
      Returns:
      whether or not the start time is on or after 8AM eastern.

    • checkEndingTime

      public static boolean checkEndingTime(ZonedDateTime userStartTime, ZonedDateTime userEndTime)
      Checks the inputted end time against the business hours to ensure it is on or before 10PM eastern. Also checks that the end time is not before the start date-time.
      Parameters:
      userStartTime - the user start date-time
      userEndTime - the user end date-time
      Returns:
      whether or not the end time is valid

    • checkOverlap

      public static boolean checkOverlap(ZonedDateTime start, ZonedDateTime end, int custId) throws SQLException
      Check on all three cases of overlaps; if any return true, the appointment add controller will not allow the appointment to be made with the inputted times.
      Parameters:
      start - the start date-time
      end - the end date-time
      custId - the customer's id
      Returns:
      whether or not overlaps exist
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • checkOverlap

      public static boolean checkOverlap(ZonedDateTime start, ZonedDateTime end, int custId, int apptId) throws SQLException
      Check on all three cases of overlaps; if any return true, the appointment add/edit controllers will not allow the appointment to be made with the inputted times. This one is specifically used for when an appointment is being edited; the appointment ID parameter will exclude the appointment from the result sets.
      Parameters:
      start - the start date-time
      end - the end date-time
      custId - the customer's ID
      apptId - the appointment ID
      Returns:
      whether or not overlaps exist
      Throws:
      SQLException

      userEnd - the user end date-time
      custId - the customer ID
      Returns:
      whether or not overlap exists
      Throws:

    • checkStartVio

      public static boolean checkStartVio(ZonedDateTime userStart, ZonedDateTime userEnd, int custId, int apptId) throws SQLException
      Checks for overlap where the beginning of a preexisting appointment can cause an overlap with the appointment's edited times. Excludes the appointment being edited.
      Parameters:
      userStart - the user start date-time
      userEnd - the user end date-time
      custId - the customer ID
      apptId - the appointment ID
      Returns:
      whether or not overlap exists
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • checkSoonAppt

      public static void checkSoonAppt(LocalDateTime provLoginTime) throws SQLException

      Checks if any appointment that comes after the moment of user log in is within 15 minutes. It will alert the user if there is; a popup will still appear if there isn't, but should there not be any upcoming appointments, it will say there are no appointments within the next 15 minutes.

      Note on the Result Set: I ran into an issue of both alerts showing up. It took a while to figure out how to make this exclusive. I tested out the "isClosed()" to return a boolean to see if the actual result set was closed or not.

      From this Stack Overflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4507440/must-jdbc-resultsets-and-statements-be-closed-separately-although-the-connection

      I learned that the result set doesn't get closed even if it iterates through the entire thing. I used the status of the result set then as a way to determine if there were associated appointments.

      The "rs.close()" before the break in the while loop explicitly closes the result set; that is the signal that a soon appointment was found.

      Parameters:
      provLoginTime - the provided login time.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • evalSoon

      public static boolean evalSoon(long timeDiff)
      Checks if the time difference between the time of login and the start time of a appointment has a difference of 15 minutes or less.
      Parameters:
      timeDiff - the time difference calculated from checkSoonAppointment
      Returns:
      whether or not the difference in time between the login time and appointment start time is within 15 minutes.
